instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1989: What is A1989? A1989 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years 2018, 2019 with EMC 3124, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00850..
definitions.820-00850: What is 820-00850? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1989</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no image
threads.message:
Hi,

I have an <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1989</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A without internal image, and rebooting

Already tried a knlown good display, but only have external image.

I can see image in the external display, but it reboots afetr a few seconds.

Client said that it stoped given image, but it worked on external display for a while.

Can you help?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1989</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no image
threads.message:
Did you test disconnecting internal LCD?
Try DFU.

Check diode mode readings on J8500 data lines.
